title: Centripetal force - block on a rotating platform

content.question: A small block of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> sits on a horizontally rotating platform, a distance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> from the axis of rotation. The coefficient of static friction between the block and the platform is <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math> and the maximum speed the block can have before sliding along the rotating platform is <math alttext="v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>. The platform rotates at a constant rate and the block’s speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is such that <math alttext="0 is less than v, which is less than v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>v</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>. Which expression represents the net force exerted on the block while the platform is rotating?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator M times v squared, and denominator R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="mu sub s, end sub, times M g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi></math>

<math alttext="mu sub s, end sub, times M g, minus the fraction with numerator M times v squared, and denominator R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator M times v squared, and denominator R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
